Nelson Mandela once said this : “ When you speak to a person in the language he understands , you reach his mind . ”

68 percent of students who have studied foreign languages have reached Higher grade A .

When children learn to speak several languages – particularly those of developing countries – they will later have better chances of finding meaningful employment in the labour market .
The schools in Scotland differ in their language supply .
Some schools focus on the classic modern languages , while others that are most important to Britain in 2020 , such as Mandarin or Japanese , will teach .
Whatever your child is interested , there will always be a variety of languages available in independent schools , with teachers specialised in this field .

Independent schools in Scotland want to provide a learning environment that is well prepared for children , and they should be given the necessary tools for their success , whatever the future may bring .
In today ’ s global business , languages remain undeniably important for the country ’ s future , and education must reflect that .
